solution.text:
A real number k is said to be a zero of a polynomial f(x), if f(k) = 0
We have to use hit and trial method by taking values of k from the options
we say k=\(\frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_}\) we get
\(f(\frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_})=_{{j*j}}_(\frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_})^2-_{{2*j*k}}_\times \frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_}+_{{k*k}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow f(\frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_})=0\)
Therefore, \(\frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_}\) is the zero of the given polynomial

content.text: From the given options, choose the zero of the polynomial \(f(x)=_{{j*j}}_x^2-_{{2*j*k}}_x+_{{k*k}}_\)
